attractions.name: Matenadaran (Mesrop Mashtots Institute of Ancient Manuscripts)

Armenia.police: Police of the Republic of Armenia, Nalbandyan St, 130, Yerevan
Armenia.hospital: Nairi Medical Center, 21 Paronyan St, Yerevan
tips: Yerevan is one of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities.
Climb to the top of the Cascade for a great view of the city and Mount Ararat on a clear day.
Try Armenian cognac and the local flatbread, lavash.

Azerbaijan.police: Baku City Main Police Department, 3 Yusif Safarov St, Baku
Azerbaijan.hospital: Central Clinical Hospital, Parliament Avenue, Baku
tips: Baku features a stunning contrast between its ancient, walled Old City and futuristic modern architecture.
The Heydar Aliyev Center, designed by Zaha Hadid, is a masterpiece of flowing design.
Azerbaijan is known as the 'Land of Fire'; visit the Yanar Dag (Burning Mountain) natural gas fire.

Bangladesh.police: Dhaka Metropolitan Police Headquarters, 36 Minto Rd, Dhaka
Bangladesh.hospital: Dhaka Medical College Hospital, Secretariat Road, Dhaka
tips: Dhaka is one of the most densely populated megacities in the world; be prepared for intense crowds and traffic.
Take a cycle-rickshaw ride for an authentic way to navigate the bustling streets of Old Dhaka.
A boat trip on the Buriganga River from Sadarghat offers a chaotic but fascinating slice of city life.

restaurants.name: CUT by Wolfgang Puck
restaurants.location: Four Seasons Hotel Bahrain Bay, Manama

Bahrain.police: Ministry of Interior Headquarters, Al Qalaa Avenue, Manama
tips: Manama is the capital of the island kingdom of Bahrain in the Persian Gulf.
Explore the bustling alleyways of the Manama Souq for spices, perfumes, and traditional goods.
The country is connected to Saudi Arabia by the 25-km King Fahd Causeway.

attractions.name: Royal Regalia Museum
attractions.location: Jalan Sultan Omar Ali Saifuddien, Bandar Seri Begawan

restaurants.name: Aminah Arif Restaurant

Brunei.hospital: Raja Isteri Pengiran Anak Saleha Hospital (RIPAS), Jalan Putera Al-Muhtadee Billah, Bandar Seri Begawan
tips: Brunei is a small, oil-rich Islamic sultanate on the island of Borneo.
Take a water taxi to explore Kampong Ayer, the world's largest stilt village.
The sale of alcohol is prohibited in Brunei.

attractions.name: Paro Taktsang (Tiger's Nest)
attractions.location: Taktsang Trail, Paro (Day trip from Thimphu)

Bhutan.hospital: Jigme Dorji Wangchuck National Referral Hospital, Gongphel Lam, Thimphu
tips: All tourism in Bhutan must be arranged through a licensed tour operator.
A mandatory daily tourist fee covers accommodation, food, transport, and a guide.
The hike to the iconic Tiger's Nest monastery near Paro is a must-do.

Cambodia.police: Phnom Penh Municipal Police, Pasteur Street (St 51), Phnom Penh
Cambodia.hospital: Calmette Hospital, 3 Monivong Blvd, Phnom Penh
tips: A visit to the Tuol Sleng Museum and Choeung Ek Killing Fields provides a sobering but important insight into Cambodia's tragic history under the Khmer Rouge.
Stroll along the riverfront promenade at Sisowath Quay.
The Central Market (Phsar Thmey) is an impressive Art Deco landmark.

restaurants.name: Cuisine Wat Damnak
restaurants.location: Wat Damnak Market street, Siem Reap

Cambodia.police: Siem Reap Provincial Police Commissary, National Road 6, Siem Reap
Cambodia.hospital: Royal Angkor International Hospital, National Route 6, Phum Kasekam, Siem Reap
tips: Purchase a multi-day Angkor Pass to fully explore the vast temple complex.
Hire a tuk-tuk for the day to easily travel between the temples.
US dollars are widely accepted, so it's often not necessary to exchange for local currency (Riel).

China.police: Hangzhou Public Security Bureau, 35 Minsheng Rd, Shangcheng District, Hangzhou
China.hospital: First Affiliated Hospital, Zhejiang University School of Medicine, 79 Qingchun Rd, Shangcheng District, Hangzhou
tips: West Lake is a UNESCO World Heritage site and has inspired poets and artists for centuries.
Rent a boat or a bicycle to explore the vast area around West Lake.
Try local specialties like Dongpo pork and West Lake fish in vinegar gravy.

attractions.name: Terracotta Army (Emperor Qinshihuang's Mausoleum Site Museum)

China.police: Xi'an Municipal Public Security Bureau, 9 Wenjing Rd, Weiyang District, Xi'an
China.hospital: First Affiliated Hospital of Xi'an Jiaotong University, 277 Yanta W Rd, Yanta District, Xi'an
tips: Xi'an is one of the ancient capitals of China and the starting point of the Silk Road.
Rent a bicycle to ride along the top of the remarkably well-preserved city wall.
Explore the bustling Muslim Quarter for incredible street food.

restaurants.name: Chunji Roasted Goose
restaurants.location: 1 Zhongshan Middle Rd, Xiufeng District, Guilin

China.police: Guilin Municipal Public Security Bureau, 26 Sanduo Rd, Xiangshan District, Guilin
China.hospital: Affiliated Hospital of Guilin Medical University, 15 Lequn Rd, Xiufeng District, Guilin
tips: Guilin is famous for its stunning karst landscape of limestone hills.
The Li River cruise from Guilin to Yangshuo offers some of China's most iconic scenery.
Try the local specialty, Guilin rice noodles (mifen).

attractions.name: Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding

restaurants.name: Chen Mapo Tofu
restaurants.location: 27 West Yulong St, Qingyang District, Chengdu

China.police: Chengdu Public Security Bureau, 48 Wenwu Rd, Qingyang District, Chengdu
China.hospital: West China Hospital, Sichuan University, 37 Guoxue Alley, Wuhou District, Chengdu
tips: Chengdu is the best place in the world to see giant pandas up close.
It's the capital of Sichuan province, renowned for its spicy and flavorful cuisine.
Relax in a traditional teahouse in People's Park.

attractions.name: Potala Palace
attractions.location: 35 Beijing Middle Rd, Chengguan District, Lhasa

restaurants.name: Dunya Restaurant
restaurants.location: 100 Beijing Middle Rd, Chengguan District, Lhasa

China.police: Public Security Bureau of Tibet Autonomous Region, 25 Linlang Rd, Lhasa
China.hospital: Tibet Autonomous Region People's Hospital, 18 Linkuo North Rd, Lhasa
tips: Travel to Tibet requires a special permit that must be arranged through a tour agency.
Lhasa is at a very high altitude (3,656m / 11,995ft); acclimatize slowly and drink lots of water.
Walk the kora (pilgrimage circuit) around Jokhang Temple with local pilgrims on Barkhor Street.

China.police: Suzhou Public Security Bureau, 89 Renmin Rd, Gusu District, Suzhou
China.hospital: First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University, 899 Pinghai Rd, Gusu District, Suzhou
tips: Suzhou is known as the 'Venice of the East' for its canals, stone bridges, and classical gardens.
Its classical gardens are collectively a UNESCO World Heritage site.
It's an easy day trip from Shanghai by high-speed train.

China.police: Zhangjiajie Public Security Bureau, Yongding Ave, Yongding District, Zhangjiajie
China.hospital: Zhangjiajie People's Hospital, 192 Jiefang Rd, Yongding District, Zhangjiajie
tips: The pillar-like rock formations in the National Forest Park were the inspiration for the 'Hallelujah Mountains' in the movie Avatar.
Take the world's longest cable car ride up Tianmen Mountain.
Allow at least 2-3 days to explore the vast park area properly.

attractions.name: The Great Wall of China (Mutianyu section)

China.police: Beijing Municipal Public Security Bureau, 9 Qianmen E St, Dongcheng, Beijing
China.hospital: Peking Union Medical College Hospital, 1 Shuaifuyuan, Dongcheng, Beijing
tips: A VPN is necessary to access many western websites and apps.
The subway system is extensive, efficient, and the easiest way to get around.
Allow a full day to explore the Forbidden City and another for the Great Wall.

attractions.name: Shanghai Tower
attractions.location: 501 Yincheng Middle Rd, Lujiazui, Pudong, Shanghai

China.police: Shanghai Municipal Public Security Bureau, 128 Wuning S Rd, Jing'an, Shanghai
China.hospital: Huashan Hospital, 12 Wulumuqi Middle Rd, Jing'an, Shanghai
tips: Stroll along The Bund at night for a spectacular view of the Pudong skyline.
Explore the charming, narrow lanes of the Former French Concession.
Mobile payments (Alipay/WeChat Pay) are dominant; setting one up can be helpful but cash is still accepted.

attractions.name: Star Ferry

restaurants.name: Mott 32
restaurants.location: Standard Chartered Bank Building, 4-4A Des Voeux Rd Central, Central

China.police: Hong Kong Police Headquarters, 1 Arsenal St, Wan Chai
China.hospital: Queen Mary Hospital, 102 Pok Fu Lam Rd, Pok Fu Lam
tips: Use an Octopus Card for seamless travel on all public transport, including ferries.
Take the Peak Tram up to Victoria Peak for iconic skyline views.
Explore the bustling street markets in Mong Kok, like the Ladies' Market.

attractions.name: The Venetian Macao

China.hospital: Centro Hospitalar Conde de São Januário, Estrada do Visconde de S. Januário, Macau

The historic centre is a UNESCO World Heritage site, showcasing a unique blend of Chinese and Portuguese cultures.

restaurants.name: Tusheng Shiguan
restaurants.location: 7 Cuihu S Rd, Wuhua District, Kunming

China.police: Kunming Public Security Bureau, 518 Beijing Rd, Panlong District, Kunming
China.hospital: First Affiliated Hospital of Kunming Medical University, 295 Xichang Rd, Xishan District, Kunming
tips: Kunming is known as the 'City of Eternal Spring' for its pleasant, mild climate year-round.
It is the capital of Yunnan province, one of China's most ethnically diverse regions.
A day trip to the otherworldly Stone Forest is a must.

Georgia.police: Ministry of Internal Affairs, Gulua Street 10, Tbilisi
tips: Take the cable car up to Narikala Fortress for incredible views of the city.
Experience a traditional sulphur bath in the Abanotubani district.
You must try Georgian cuisine staples like Khachapuri (cheese bread) and Khinkali (dumplings).

restaurants.name: Upre by 1559 AD

India.police: Udaipur District Police Office, near Collectorate, Udaipur
India.hospital: Maharana Bhupal Government Hospital, Hospital Rd, Udaipur
tips: Known as the 'City of Lakes,' Udaipur is often considered one of India's most romantic destinations.
Take a boat ride on Lake Pichola for stunning views of the City Palace and Lake Palace.
Stay in a converted 'haveli' (traditional mansion) for an authentic experience.

attractions.name: Golden Temple (Harmandir Sahib)
attractions.location: Golden Temple Rd, Atta Mandi, Katra Ahluwalia, Amritsar

India.police: Amritsar City Police Commissionerate, Queen's Road, Amritsar
India.hospital: Guru Nanak Dev Hospital, Majitha Road, Amritsar
tips: The Golden Temple is the holiest shrine in Sikhism; remember to cover your head before entering.
Witness the highly theatrical and patriotic flag-lowering ceremony at the Wagah Border with Pakistan.
Partake in the 'langar,' the free community meal served to all visitors at the Golden Temple.

attractions.name: Umaid Bhawan Palace
attractions.location: Circuit House Rd, Cantt Area, Jodhpur

India.police: Jodhpur Police Commissionerate, BJS Colony, Jodhpur
India.hospital: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Jodhpur, Basni Industrial Area, Jodhpur
tips: Jodhpur is known as the 'Blue City' for the blue-painted houses in its old town.
Mehrangarh Fort is one of the largest and most magnificent forts in India, towering over the city.
Explore the old city's Sardar Market and clock tower for spices and textiles.

restaurants.name: The Rice Boat
restaurants.location: Taj Malabar Resort & Spa, Willingdon Island, Kochi

India.police: Office of the Commissioner of Police, Marine Drive, Kochi
tips: Kochi is a historic port city in the state of Kerala with a rich history of trade.
Watch the fishermen operate the iconic Chinese fishing nets at sunset.
Use Kochi as a starting point to explore the serene backwaters of Kerala.

India.police: Shimla District Police Office, near DC Office, Shimla
India.hospital: Indira Gandhi Medical College (IGMC), Circular Road, Shimla
tips: Shimla was the summer capital of British India.
Ride the historic Kalka-Shimla 'toy train,' a UNESCO World Heritage site, for a scenic journey.
Stroll along the pedestrian-only Mall Road and The Ridge.

restaurants.name: Pinch of Spice
restaurants.location: 23/453, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Wazirpura Road, Agra

India.police: Tourist Police Station, Near Taj Mahal Eastern Gate, Agra
India.hospital: S.N. Medical College & Hospital, Moti Katra, Agra
tips: Visit the Taj Mahal at sunrise for the best light and fewer crowds.
The Taj Mahal is closed to the public every Friday.
Beware of touts and unofficial guides; use only government-approved guides.

restaurants.name: Dosa Cafe
restaurants.location: D-15/46, Maan Mandir, Dasaswamedh Ghat, Varanasi

India.police: Varanasi Police Line, Kachahari Road, Nadesar, Varanasi
India.hospital: Sir Sunderlal Hospital, Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi
tips: Varanasi is one of the oldest living cities in the world and a major Hindu pilgrimage site.
Take a boat ride on the Ganges at sunrise to witness morning rituals.
Witness the Ganga Aarti, a spectacular fire ceremony, held at Dasaswamedh Ghat every evening.

India.police: Goa Police Headquarters, Near Azad Maidan, Panaji, Goa
India.hospital: Goa Medical College and Hospital, Bambolim, Goa
tips: Goa is famous for its beaches, nightlife, and Portuguese colonial heritage.

North Goa is known for its party atmosphere, while South Goa is more relaxed and tranquil.

attractions.name: Victoria Memorial
attractions.location: Victoria Memorial Hall, 1, Queen's Way, Kolkata

India.police: Kolkata Police Headquarters, 18, Lalbazar Street, Kolkata

Ride the iconic yellow Ambassador taxis and the historic tram.
Try local Bengali sweets like 'rasgulla' and 'sandesh'.

India.police: Leh Police Station, Main Bazaar Road, Leh
India.hospital: Sonam Norboo Memorial Hospital, Skara, Leh
tips: Leh is in the high-altitude desert region of Ladakh.
You must spend at least one full day acclimatizing to the altitude (3,500m / 11,500ft) before any activity.
The best time to visit is during the summer months from June to September.

tips: Use ride-hailing apps like Uber or Ola for convenient and fixed-price travel.
Be cautious with street food to avoid 'Delhi belly'; only eat from busy, reputable vendors.
The Delhi Metro is a clean, fast, and efficient way to navigate the sprawling city.

tips: Use the local train network for north-south travel, but avoid peak hours.
Stroll along Marine Drive at sunset, also known as the 'Queen's Necklace'.
Mumbai is the heart of India's Bollywood film industry.

Explore the city's famous craft beer and pub scene in areas like Indiranagar.

tips: Surabaya is Indonesia's second-largest city and the main gateway to Mount Bromo.
A tour to watch the sunrise over the volcanic crater of Mount Bromo is an unforgettable experience.
The city is known as 'The City of Heroes' for its role in the Indonesian independence struggle.

Mount Rinjani is a challenging multi-day trek for serious hikers.

tips: Dress modestly when visiting holy sites (cover shoulders and knees).

The Old City is divided into four quarters: Jewish, Christian, Muslim, and Armenian.

Israel.hospital: Tel Aviv Sourasky Medical Center (Ichilov), Weizmann St 6, Tel Aviv
tips: Tel Aviv is a vibrant, modern city known for its nightlife, beaches, and Bauhaus architecture.
The city has an excellent public bike-sharing system (Tel-O-Fun).
Explore the ancient port city of Jaffa, which is now part of Tel Aviv.

restaurants.name: Toranj Food Complex
restaurants.location: Jolfa Hotel, Hakim Nezami St, Isfahan

tips: Naqsh-e Jahan Square is a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the largest city squares in the world.
Visit the historic bridges, Khaju and Si-o-Se-Pol, which are beautifully lit at night.

Japan.hospital: Hokkaido University Hospital, 14 Kita 14 Jonishi, Kita Ward, Sapporo
tips: Visit in February for the spectacular Sapporo Snow Festival.
Sapporo is famous for its miso ramen.
Hokkaido, the island where Sapporo is located, is renowned for its high-quality dairy and seafood.

Japan.police: Fukuoka Prefectural Police Headquarters, 7-7 Higashikoen, Hakata Ward, Fukuoka
Japan.hospital: Kyushu University Hospital, 3 Chome-1-1 Maidashi, Higashi Ward, Fukuoka
tips: Fukuoka is the largest city on the island of Kyushu.
It is famous for its 'yatai' (open-air food stalls) that line the river in the evenings.
This is the birthplace of Tonkotsu (pork bone broth) ramen.

Japan.police: Ishikawa Prefectural Police Headquarters, 2 Chome-1-1 Hirosaka, Kanazawa
Japan.hospital: Kanazawa University Hospital, 13-1 Takaramachi, Kanazawa, Ishikawa
tips: Kanazawa is known for its exceptionally well-preserved Edo-period districts.
Kenrokuen is considered one of Japan's three most beautiful landscape gardens.
The city is a center for high-quality crafts, including gold leaf products and lacquerware.

Japan.police: Osaka Prefectural Police Headquarters, 1 Chome-3-18 Otemae, Chuo Ward, Osaka
Japan.hospital: Osaka University Hospital, 2-15 Yamadaoka, Suita, Osaka
tips: Osaka is known as the 'Kitchen of Japan' for its incredible food scene.
Try local specialties like takoyaki (octopus balls) and okonomiyaki (savory pancake) in Dotonbori.
The city has a more laid-back and boisterous vibe compared to Tokyo.

Try Hiroshima-style okonomiyaki, which is layered and includes noodles.

Japan.police: Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department Headquarters, 2-1-1 Kasumigaseki, Chiyoda City, Tokyo
Japan.hospital: The University of Tokyo Hospital, 7-3-1 Hongo, Bunkyo City, Tokyo
tips: Purchase a Suica or Pasmo card for convenient travel on public transport.
Stand on the left side of escalators to allow others to pass on the right.
Cash is still widely used, especially at smaller shops and restaurants.

Japan.police: Kyoto Prefectural Police Headquarters, 85-3 Yabunouchicho, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto
Japan.hospital: Kyoto University Hospital, 54 Shogoin Kawaharacho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto
tips: Kyoto was the former imperial capital of Japan and is its cultural heart.
Rent a bicycle to explore the city's relatively flat terrain.
Visit the Gion district in the early evening for a chance to spot a geisha or maiko.

Japan.police: Nara Prefectural Police Headquarters, 30 Noboriojicho, Nara
Japan.hospital: Nara Prefectural General Medical Center, 1 Chome-30-1 Nanakuriyama, Nara
tips: Nara was Japan's first permanent capital.
The city is famous for its wild (but very tame) deer that roam Nara Park and will bow for crackers.
Todai-ji Temple houses a 15-meter tall bronze statue of the Buddha.

Japan.police: Okinawa Prefectural Police Headquarters, 1 Chome-2-2 Izumizaki, Naha, Okinawa
Japan.hospital: Okinawa Prefectural Nanbu Medical Center & Children's Medical Center, 118-1 Aza-shinkawa, Haebaru
tips: Okinawa is Japan's southernmost prefecture, known for its subtropical climate and unique Ryukyuan culture.
Try local Okinawan dishes like goya champuru (bitter melon stir-fry) and Okinawa soba.
The Churaumi Aquarium is one of the largest and most impressive in the world.
Amman is the best base for day trips to major sites like Petra, Jerash, and the Dead Sea.
Purchase the Jordan Pass online before your trip to cover your visa fee and entry to most major sites.
The city is built on seven hills, so be prepared for steep climbs.

Jordan.police: Wadi Musa Police Department, Wadi Musa
Jordan.hospital: Queen Rania Al Abdullah Hospital, Wadi Musa
tips: Wadi Musa is the gateway town to the ancient city of Petra.
Wear comfortable, sturdy shoes as you will be walking for many hours on uneven terrain.
Visit 'Petra by Night' for a magical experience of seeing the Treasury lit by thousands of candles.

Kyrgyzstan.police: Ministry of Internal Affairs, Frunze Street 469, Bishkek
Kyrgyzstan.hospital: National Hospital of the Ministry of Health, Togolok Moldo Street 1, Bishkek
tips: Bishkek is a green city with many Soviet-era buildings and parks.
It's the main gateway for treks into the stunning Tian Shan mountains.
Osh Bazaar is a vibrant and sprawling market where you can experience local life.

Kazakhstan.police: Almaty City Police Department, Masanchi Street 57А, Almaty
Kazakhstan.hospital: Central City Clinical Hospital No. 12, Dzhandosov Street 6, Almaty
tips: Almaty is nestled at the foot of the impressive Tian Shan mountains.
The city is very green with numerous parks and tree-lined streets.
Take the cable car up Kok-Tobe for panoramic views of the city and mountains.

Kazakhstan.police: Nur-Sultan City Police Department, Zheltoksan Street 43, Nur-Sultan
Kazakhstan.hospital: National Scientific Medical Center, Abylai Khan Avenue 42, Nur-Sultan
tips: The city, formerly known as Astana, is the futuristic capital of Kazakhstan.
It is known for its bold, modern architecture designed by international architects.
Winters are extremely cold, making it one of the coldest capital cities in the world.

attractions.name: Souq Al-Mubarakiya
attractions.location: Between Abdullah Al-Mubarak, Abdullah Al-Salem & Palestine St, Kuwait City

Kuwait.police: Ministry of Interior, 6th Ring Road, Sabhan
Kuwait.hospital: Al Amiri Hospital, Arabian Gulf St, Kuwait City
tips: The Kuwait Towers are an iconic symbol of the modern state of Kuwait.
Explore the traditional Souq Al-Mubarakiya for an authentic market experience.
Summers are incredibly hot, with temperatures often exceeding 45°C (113°F).

attractions.name: Jeita Grotto
attractions.location: Valley of the Dog River, Keserwan District

Lebanon.police: Internal Security Forces Headquarters, Ashrafieh, Beirut
Lebanon.hospital: American University of Beirut Medical Center (AUBMC), Makdessi St, Beirut
tips: Once known as the 'Paris of the Middle East,' Beirut has a vibrant nightlife and culinary scene.
The city shows a fascinating mix of modern reconstruction alongside war-scarred buildings.
Always check current travel advisories before planning a trip to Lebanon.

Laos.hospital: Mahosot Hospital, Quai Fa Ngum, Vientiane
tips: Vientiane is one of Southeast Asia's most relaxed and laid-back capital cities.
Rent a bicycle to explore the city's temples and French colonial villas.
Climb to the top of Patuxai for panoramic views of the city.

Laos.police: Luang Prabang Provincial Police Station, Main Road, Luang Prabang
Laos.hospital: Luang Prabang Provincial Hospital, Souphanouvong Road, Luang Prabang
tips: The entire town is a UNESCO World Heritage site for its unique fusion of traditional and colonial architecture.
Wake up early to witness the Sai Bat, the morning alms-giving ceremony for monks.
Climb Mount Phousi at sunset for a 360-degree view of the town and Mekong River.

Mongolia.police: National Police Agency of Mongolia, Chinggis Avenue, Ulaanbaatar
Mongolia.hospital: Intermed Hospital, Chinggis Avenue 41, Khan-Uul District, Ulaanbaatar
tips: Ulaanbaatar is the starting point for all trips into the vast Mongolian steppe.
The city experiences extreme temperature variations, with very cold winters.
Arrange a tour to stay in a traditional 'ger' (yurt) for an authentic nomadic experience.

attractions.name: Petronas Twin Towers
attractions.location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, 50088 Kuala Lumpur

restaurants.name: Jalan Alor Food Street
restaurants.location: Jalan Alor, Bukit Bintang, Kuala Lumpur

restaurants.name: Dewakan

Malaysia.police: Ibu Pejabat Polis Kontinjen Kuala Lumpur, Jalan Hang Tuah, 55200 Kuala Lumpur
Malaysia.hospital: Kuala Lumpur Hospital, Jalan Pahang, 50586 Kuala Lumpur
tips: Use the Grab app (Southeast Asia's Uber) for convenient transportation.
Book tickets for the Petronas Towers' skybridge online in advance.
Dress modestly if you plan to visit the Batu Caves, a Hindu shrine.

Malaysia.police: Ibu Pejabat Polis Kontinjen Pulau Pinang, Jalan Penang, George Town
Malaysia.hospital: Penang General Hospital, Jalan Residensi, George Town
tips: The historic center of George Town is a UNESCO World Heritage site.
Go on a scavenger hunt to find the famous street art murals by Ernest Zacharevic.
Penang is considered one of the best street food destinations in the world.

restaurants.name: Ithaa Undersea Restaurant
restaurants.location: Conrad Rangali Island, Alif Dhaal Atoll

Maldives.police: Maldives Police Service Headquarters, Shaheed Hussain Adam Building, Malé
tips: Malé is the densely populated capital, but most tourists transfer to resort islands.
Alcohol is prohibited in Malé but is available at the private resorts.
The Maldives is famous for its overwater bungalows and incredible snorkeling/diving.

restaurants.name: Shan Yoe Yar
restaurants.location: 169 War Tan Street, Lanmadaw Township, Yangon

Myanmar.police: Yangon Region Police Force Head Office, No. 54, Kannar Road, Yangon
Myanmar.hospital: Yangon General Hospital, Bogyoke Aung San Road, Yangon
tips: The Shwedagon Pagoda is one of Buddhism's most sacred sites.
Ride the slow-moving circular train for an authentic glimpse into local life.
Always check current travel advisories before planning a trip to Myanmar.

restaurants.name: Be Kind to Animals The Moon
restaurants.location: North of Ananda Temple, Old Bagan

tips: Bagan is an ancient city with over 2,000 Buddhist temples, pagodas, and monasteries.
Rent an e-bike to explore the vast temple-strewn plains at your own pace.
A sunrise hot air balloon ride over the temples is a breathtaking and iconic experience.

attractions.hospital: CIWEC Hospital Travel Medicine Center, Kapurdhara Marg, Kathmandu
tips: Kathmandu is the gateway to the Himalayas and Everest Base Camp treks.
Explore the bustling streets and shops of the Thamel tourist district.
Be prepared for power outages and dusty conditions.

attractions.hospital: Western Regional Hospital (Gandaki Hospital), Ramghat, Pokhara
tips: Pokhara is the main gateway for treks into the Annapurna mountain range.
Go paragliding from Sarangkot for incredible views of the Himalayas and Phewa Lake.
The atmosphere is much more relaxed and tranquil compared to Kathmandu.

attractions.name: Juche Tower
attractions.location: East bank of the Taedong River, Pyongyang

tips: Travel to North Korea is only possible on a fully guided tour booked through a specialized agency.
Your itinerary is fixed, and you will be accompanied by guides at all times.
Photography is heavily restricted; always ask for permission before taking any pictures.

Oman.police: Royal Oman Police Headquarters, Qurum, Muscat
Oman.hospital: Royal Hospital, Al Ghubrah St, Muscat
tips: The Sultan Qaboos Grand Mosque is an architectural marvel; a strict modest dress code is enforced.
Unlike its neighbors, Muscat has maintained its traditional character with low-rise white buildings.
Explore the enchanting alleyways of the Muttrah Souq for frankincense and souvenirs.

restaurants.name: Barbara's Heritage Restaurant
restaurants.location: Plaza San Luis Complex, Intramuros, Manila

Philippines.police: Manila Police District Headquarters, United Nations Ave, Ermita, Manila
Philippines.hospital: Philippine General Hospital, Taft Ave, Ermita, Manila
tips: Intramuros is the historic walled city built by the Spanish in the 16th century.
Traffic in Manila is extremely congested; plan travel times accordingly.
Ride a traditional 'jeepney' for a unique local transport experience.

attractions.name: Basilica Minore del Santo Niño de Cebú
attractions.location: Pilgrim's Center, Osmeña Blvd, Cebu City

attractions.name: Kawasan Falls

Philippines.police: Cebu City Police Office, Gorordo Ave, Cebu City
Philippines.hospital: Chong Hua Hospital, Don Mariano Cui St, Cebu City
tips: Cebu City is a major hub for travel throughout the central Visayas region.
It's the oldest city in the Philippines.
Use Cebu as a base for whale shark watching in Oslob or canyoneering at Kawasan Falls.

Philippines.police: Boracay Tourist Assistance Center, Station 3, Manoc-Manoc, Malay
Philippines.hospital: Ciriaco S. Tirol Hospital, Station 1, Balabag, Malay
tips: Boracay is famous for its stunningly beautiful White Beach with powdery sand.
The island has undergone significant environmental rehabilitation.
Take a 'paraw' (outrigger sailboat) ride at sunset for beautiful photos.

restaurants.name: Nobu Doha
restaurants.location: Four Seasons Hotel, The Corniche, Doha

Qatar.hospital: Hamad General Hospital, Al Rayyan Rd, Doha
tips: Doha has a modern and efficient metro system.
Dress conservatively out of respect for local culture.
Visit Souq Waqif in the evening when it comes alive with people and activity.

attractions.name: Al Masmak Fortress

Saudi Arabia.hospital: King Faisal Specialist Hospital and Research Centre, Zahrawi St, Al Maather, Riyadh
tips: Riyadh is the modern, rapidly transforming capital of Saudi Arabia.
Be aware of and respect local laws and customs, including dress codes.
The historic area of Diriyah is a UNESCO World Heritage site and the ancestral home of the Saudi royal family.

restaurants.name: Odette
restaurants.location: 1 St Andrew's Rd, #01-04 National Gallery, Singapore

Singapore.police: Police Cantonment Complex, 391 New Bridge Rd, Singapore
Singapore.hospital: Singapore General Hospital, Outram Rd, Singapore
tips: Singapore is known for its cleanliness; fines for littering are very high.
Eat at the local hawker centres for delicious and affordable food.
The public transport (MRT) system is extremely clean, safe, and efficient.

South Korea.police: Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency, 38 Sajik-ro 8-gil, Jongno-gu, Seoul
South Korea.hospital: Seoul National University Hospital, 101 Daehak-ro, Jongno-gu, Seoul
tips: Get a T-money card for easy payment on subways, buses, and in convenience stores.
Wi-Fi is widely available in most public areas.
Try Korean BBQ and visit a 'jjimjilbang' (public bathhouse) for a local experience.

South Korea.police: Jeju Provincial Police Agency, 23 Mugeunseong 7-gil, Jeju-si
South Korea.hospital: Jeju National University Hospital, 15 Aran 13-gil, Jeju-si
tips: Jeju is a volcanic island and a UNESCO World Heritage site, often called the 'Hawaii of Korea'.
Try the local black pork BBQ.
Renting a car is the most convenient way to explore the island.

South Korea.police: Busan Metropolitan Police Agency, 12 Jungang-daero, Jung-gu, Busan
South Korea.hospital: Pusan National University Hospital, 179 Gudeok-ro, Seo-gu, Busan
tips: Busan is South Korea's second-largest city, famous for its beaches and seafood.
Explore the colorful, art-filled alleyways of the Gamcheon Culture Village.
Try 'Nakji-bokkeum' (spicy stir-fried octopus), a local specialty.

restaurants.name: Nuga Gama
restaurants.location: Cinnamon Grand Colombo, 77 Galle Rd, Colombo

Sri Lanka.police: Sri Lanka Police Headquarters, Church Street, Colombo
Sri Lanka.hospital: National Hospital of Sri Lanka, E. W. Perera Mawatha, Colombo
tips: Colombo is a bustling capital city with a rich colonial heritage.
Take a ride in a 'tuk-tuk' (three-wheeler) for short distances.
Enjoy sunset views and street food at the Galle Face Green promenade.

restaurants.name: A Minute by Tuk Tuk
restaurants.location: Dutch Hospital Shopping Precinct, Galle Fort

tips: The Galle Fort, built by the Portuguese and fortified by the Dutch, is a UNESCO World Heritage site.
Walk the fort walls at sunset for stunning ocean views.
Galle is a great base to explore the beautiful beaches of Sri Lanka's south coast.

attractions.name: The Grand Palace & Wat Phra Kaew
attractions.location: Na Phra Lan Rd, Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Phra Nakhon, Bangkok

Thailand.hospital: Bumrungrad International Hospital, 33 Soi Sukhumvit 3, Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Bangkok
tips: Use the BTS Skytrain or MRT subway to avoid the city's notorious traffic.
Dress respectfully (cover shoulders and knees) when visiting temples.
Thai street food is some of the best in the world; be adventurous but choose busy stalls.

Thailand.hospital: Bangkok Hospital Phuket, 2/1 Hongyok Utis Rd, Talat Yai, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket
tips: Phuket is Thailand's largest island and a major beach resort destination.
Rent a scooter to explore the island's many beaches, but drive cautiously.
The nightlife on Bangla Road in Patong is famous and very intense.

Thailand.hospital: Maharaj Nakorn Chiang Mai Hospital, 110 Inthawarorot Rd, Si Phum, Mueang Chiang Mai District
tips: Chiang Mai is the cultural hub of Northern Thailand, known for its temples and mountains.
Visit an ethical elephant sanctuary, like Elephant Nature Park (book well in advance).
Try Khao Soi, a creamy coconut curry noodle soup that is a local specialty.

Tajikistan.police: Ministry of Internal Affairs, Tekhron Street 21, Dushanbe
Tajikistan.hospital: National Medical Center, Sanoi Street, Dushanbe
tips: Dushanbe is known for its beautiful parks and neoclassical architecture.
The city is a base for travelers heading into the Pamir Mountains.
Visit the impressive Kohi Navruz, a modern complex that looks like a palace but functions as a cultural and event center.

attractions.name: Taipei 101
attractions.location: No. 7, Section 5, Xinyi Rd, Xinyi District, Taipei

tips: Get an EasyCard for convenient travel on the highly efficient MRT system.
Exploring the vibrant night markets is a must-do for incredible street food ('xiaochi').
The National Palace Museum holds the world's largest collection of Chinese imperial artifacts.

Turkmenistan.police: Ministry of Internal Affairs, 2011 Street, Ashgabat
Turkmenistan.hospital: International Medical Center, Bekrova Street, Ashgabat
tips: Travel to Turkmenistan almost always requires a guided tour.
Ashgabat is known for its unique and grandiose white marble architecture.
A tour to the Darvaza Gas Crater, often called the 'Door to Hell,' is an unforgettable experience.

Visit during the winter months (November to March) for the most pleasant weather.

Abu Dhabi is the capital of the UAE and is generally more conservative than Dubai.
Try a 'palace cappuccino' sprinkled with real 24-karat gold flakes at the Emirates Palace.

Uzbekistan.police: Samarkand City Department of Internal Affairs, Gagarin St, Samarkand
Uzbekistan.hospital: Samarkand Regional Multidisciplinary Medical Center, Rudaki St, Samarkand
tips: Samarkand is a key historic city on the Silk Road.
The intricate tilework on the madrasahs in Registan Square is breathtaking.
The Uzbek Som is the local currency; cash is useful, especially in markets.

Uzbekistan.hospital: Bukhara Regional Multidisciplinary Medical Center, Navoi Avenue, Bukhara

Get lost wandering the ancient, maze-like alleyways of the old city.

The Old Quarter is a fascinating maze of streets, each historically specializing in a different trade.

Take an overnight cruise to fully experience the beauty of the bay and its thousands of limestone karsts.
Ha Long Bay is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

tips: Nha Trang is Vietnam's most popular coastal resort city, known for its long sandy beach and diving sites.
Take a cable car over the sea to the VinWonders amusement park.
Enjoy a therapeutic mud bath at one of the local spas.

A trip to the Cu Chi Tunnels provides a sobering look into the Vietnam War.
Use a ride-hailing app like Grab for scooter taxis ('Grab Bike') for a fun and fast way to get around.

Hoi An is famous for its highly skilled and affordable tailors.
A ticket is required to enter the Ancient Town, which includes access to several historic sites.

tips: Da Nang is a modern coastal city with long sandy beaches.
It serves as a great base for visiting Hoi An, the Marble Mountains, and Ba Na Hills.
Watch the Dragon Bridge breathe fire and water on Saturday and Sunday nights at 9 PM.
